name: Mavalli Tiffin Rooms (MTR)
location: #14, Lalbagh Road, Bengaluru - 560027
reviews: The Rava Idli is a must-try! Truly a piece of Bangalore's history.
Classic South Indian tiffins that never disappoint. Expect a queue!
Simple, authentic, and incredibly affordable. Best filter coffee.
Great taste and quality, though the service is a bit rushed.
Worth the hype. The Masala Dosa is perfectly crisp.

name: Karavalli
location: The Gateway Hotel, 66 Residency Road, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, 560025
reviews: Exceptional seafood and a beautiful setting. Perfect for a special occasion.
Luxury dining at its best. The coastal curries are phenomenal.
The Prawn Ghee Roast was divine! Impeccable service.
A culinary journey through the South Indian coast. Highly recommended.
Pricy, but the ambiance and food quality justify the cost.

name: Mysuru Mylari Hotel (Vinayaka Mylari)
location: Agrahara Fort, 67/6, Sayyaji Rao Rd, KR Mohalla, Mysuru, 570004
reviews: The melt-in-your-mouth Masala Dosa is legendary. A true Mysore gem.
Incredibly soft dosas and simple, delicious chutney. Small place, huge taste.
A historic and affordable breakfast spot. Be ready to stand in line.
Only serves a few items, but everything is perfect. Pure authentic food.
Best dosa I've ever had, hands down. Must visit when in Mysuru.

name: Pai Tiffins
location: 12-3-285/1, Mahalakshmi Building, Car Street, Kodailbail, Mangaluru
reviews: The Neer Dosa here is exceptionally light and soft. Authentic Mangalorean flavors.
Loved the Goli Bajji, perfectly fried and fluffy. Great affordable tiffins.
A go-to spot for simple, delicious Coastal Karnataka breakfast.
Quick service and high quality, local vegetarian food.
Great value for money. The Sajjige-Bajji combo is classic.

name: Toit Brewpub
location: 298, Namma Metro Pillar 62, 100 Feet Road, Indiranagar, Bengaluru
reviews: Fantastic craft beer selection, especially the Basmati Blonde.
The vibe is energetic, and the pub food is great, especially the pizzas.
The heart of Bangalore's nightlife. Always packed, book in advance.
Excellent place to hang out with friends. Good music and ambiance.
Tried their steak and it was surprisingly good for a brewpub!

name: Nagarjuna Restaurant
location: 44/1, Residency Road, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru (One of the popular branches)
reviews: The Andhra meals and Biryani are intensely spicy and delicious. Not for the faint-hearted!
Guntur Chicken is a fiery delight. Consistently great non-veg options.
A Bengaluru institution for authentic, piping hot Andhra food.
The chilli factor is real, but the flavor is addictive. Excellent value.
Fast service, great for a quick, hearty and spicy lunch.

name: Khanavali (North Karnataka Style)
location: Basaveshwara Khanavali, Nehru Stadium Road, Hubballi-Dharwad (Specific location for a representative restaurant)
reviews: Authentic and soul-satisfying Jolada Rotti meals. A taste of North Karnataka.
Simple, no-frills setting, but the food is bursting with traditional flavour.
The different side curries and chutneys with the Rotti are amazing.
Extremely affordable and a very filling, wholesome meal.
If you want real, rustic Karnataka food, a Khanavali is the place to be.

name: Pallavi Bar and Restaurant
location: Mahadevi Complex, Padubidri Main Road, Nadsal, Padubidri (Near Mangaluru, as per search result)
reviews: Some of the freshest seafood in the region. The Fish Fry is excellent.
A classic spot for authentic Mangalorean non-veg dishes.
Good atmosphere and consistently high-quality, spicy coastal food.
Tried the prawn curry and it was spiced just right. Highly recommend.
Reliable place for a good, non-vegetarian meal near the coast.

name: Vidyarthi Bhavan
location: 32, Gandhi Bazaar Main Rd, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, 560004
reviews: The crispest, butteriest Masala Dosa in Bangalore. An absolute must-visit!
An iconic, historic tiffin room. The waiters carry stacks of dosas!
Don't expect fancy ambiance, but expect incredible, authentic food.
The crowds are a testament to their fantastic quality and value.
Best breakfast experience in Basavanagudi. Filter coffee is also great.

name: Sagar Fast Food
location: 8j38+qh, Gangothri Layout, Mysuru, 570009 (Sri Sagar Fast Food, one of the famous Sagar spots)
reviews: Amazing Pav Bhaji and other fast food favorites at street-food prices.
Great for a quick and satisfying evening snack or casual meal.
Very affordable and the North Indian options are quite tasty.
Quick service and consistently good chaat items. Local favorite spot.
Perfect place to grab a quick, cheap, and cheerful bite.

name: Koshy's Parade Cafe
location: 39, St Marks Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, 560001
reviews: Stepping into Koshy's is like stepping back in time. Great old-world charm.
The classic omelets and cutlets are superb. Must have the filter coffee.
A true Bangalore institution, perfect for a relaxed breakfast or tea.
Simple, comforting food and an unhurried, good vibe. Highly recommended.
A great meeting point. Continental dishes are quite satisfying.

name: Meghana Foods
location: No.1066, AECS Layout, Hosur Main Road, Singasandra, Bengaluru, 560068 (One of the popular branches)
reviews: The best Biryani in Bangalore, perfectly spiced and flavourful.
Quick service, affordable prices, and delicious Andhra-style Biryani.
Warning: the food is spicy, but totally worth the heat!
Always crowded, which speaks volumes about the quality.
Great spot for a satisfying and non-vegetarian friendly meal.

name: GTR (Guru Tiffin Room)
location: 2954, 1, NS Road, near Ramachandra Agrahara, Chamundipuram, Mysuru, 570004
reviews: The Butter Dosa here is truly divine—crispy and loaded with flavor.
Classic, old-school tiffin room experience. Very affordable and authentic.
Fantastic breakfast spot in Mysuru. A true local secret.
Simple menu, but everything is cooked to perfection. High quality food.
Be prepared for a small, crowded space, but the taste makes it worthwhile.

name: Coast 2 Coast
location: Lighthouse Hill Road, Mangaluru
reviews: The Prawn Ghee Roast is the best I've ever tasted. Rich and spicy.
Excellent place for authentic Mangalorean seafood.
High-quality, fresh fish and prompt service. Great overall experience.
Must try the fish curries; they are packed with coastal flavor.
A bit on the pricier side, but the food is worth every penny.

name: Central Tiffin Room (CTR) - Shri Sagar
location: 7th Cross Road, Margosa Road, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru
reviews: The Benne Masala Dosa is legendary, dripping with butter and perfectly crisp.
A classic and historic spot in Malleshwaram. Expect a long wait.
Incredibly affordable and authentic Bangalore tiffin experience.
Tried the Mangalore Bajji and it was great too. Must end with Filter Coffee.
Fantastic food quality that remains consistent despite the crowds.

name: Plan B
location: Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru
reviews: The best Chicken Wings in the city, especially the spicy ones.
A chilled-out bar vibe with great American comfort food.
Affordable drinks and decent pub grub. Perfect for a casual evening.
Great place to catch a game and have some juicy burgers.
The portions are generous and the food is consistently good.

name: The Barge
location: Hebbal Industrial Area, Mysuru
reviews: Excellent microbrewery with a great selection of fresh craft beers.
The ambiance is sophisticated, making it a perfect luxury dining spot.
Impressive range of multicuisine dishes, all prepared well.
Good for a group outing. Enjoyed the rooftop seating area.
High quality experience, though definitely on the expensive side for Mysuru.

name: Shetty Lunch Home
location: Balmatta Road, near Hotel Usha, Hampankatta, Mangaluru
reviews: The Fish Thali is a fantastic, affordable, and filling non-veg meal.
Authentic Mangalorean seafood experience in a simple setting.
Great place for a hearty lunch. The Fish Curry is spicy and delicious.
Very popular among locals for its reliable quality and taste.
Tried the Anjal (Kingfish) Fry, and it was perfectly cooked.

name: Brahmin's Coffee Bar
location: Near Shankar Mutt, Ranga Rao Road, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru
reviews: Their Idli and Vada, dipped in their signature chutney, is bliss.
A standing-only, no-frills, historic gem. Incredibly fast service.
Best place for a quick, authentic, and dirt-cheap South Indian breakfast.
The Khara Bath is equally amazing. Everything is fresh and hot.
A must-visit for any South Indian food lover in Bangalore.

name: Kamat Bugle Rock
location: 1, 5th Main Road, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru
reviews: The Thatte Idli is a fluffy, large-sized treat. Very soft and satisfying.
Reliable and authentic Karnataka vegetarian food. Good for family dining.
Affordable prices and quick, friendly service. A historic Bangalore spot.
Their Bisibele Bath is also excellent. Tried and tested quality.
Classic South Indian staples served well. A great place for a quick meal.

name: The Glass House
location: Lavelle Road, Bengaluru
reviews: Stunning glass architecture and fantastic, upscale ambiance.
Great cocktails and inventive fusion European dishes.
Perfect for a date night or a luxurious evening out. High-end dining.
The service is attentive, and the presentation of food is top-notch.
Expensive, but the unique setting and food quality are worth the splurge.

name: Hotel Sarathi
location: Kalyanagiri, Mysuru
reviews: Incredible Mutton Biryani, truly rich and aromatic.
Affordable prices for high-quality, authentic non-vegetarian food.
A no-fuss place that serves delicious and satisfying Indian meals.
Tried their Chicken Kebab and it was perfectly marinated and fried.
Great local spot, especially famous for its Biryani variants.

name: Pai Tiffins
location: Manipal Commercial Complex, Eshwar Nagar, Manipal, Udupi
reviews: Classic Udupi tiffins done right. The Masala Dosa is great.
Very affordable and perfect for students. Quick and authentic breakfast.
The quality of the tiffins is reliably good. Loved the Upma.
Great place to experience traditional Udupi vegetarian food.
Simple setup, but great taste and value for money.

name: The Black Sheep Bistro
location: Balmatta, Mangaluru
reviews: Very innovative menu with delicious fusion dishes. A welcome change.
The ambiance is stylish and contemporary. Great place for a young crowd.
High rating is deserved. Tried their signature cocktail and loved it.
Excellent Continental fare, well-prepared and presented.
A bit expensive but worth it for the modern, unique dining experience.

name: Chowman
location: 2383, E Block, Sahakara Nagar, Bengaluru
reviews: Consistently great and authentic Chinese food. Good portion sizes.
Very reliable spot, especially for home delivery. Quick and efficient.
The chili chicken is a must-try. Affordable compared to other Chinese places.
A pleasant surprise for good quality Asian cuisine in the area.
Enjoyed the Hakka Noodles and the overall value for money.

name: Vidyarthi Bhavan
location: No-32, Gandhi Bazar Main Road, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru
reviews: The crispest, butteriest Masala Dosa in Bangalore. An absolute must-visit!
An iconic, historic tiffin room. The waiters carry stacks of dosas!
Don't expect fancy ambiance, but expect incredible, authentic food.
The crowds are a testament to their fantastic quality and value.
Best breakfast experience in Basavanagudi. Filter coffee is also great.

name: Tippu Soolthan Bar & Restaurant
location: Kalyanagiri, Mysuru
reviews: Fantastic Mutton Biryani and other spicy local mutton preparations.
A classic, no-frills local favorite for non-vegetarian food.
Very affordable prices for hearty, flavor-packed meals.
Tried the Chicken Kebab and it was quite good. Great for a casual non-veg meal.
Popular spot, especially in the evenings. Authentic local taste.

name: Spice Bazaar
location: Club Road, Hubballi
reviews: A great option for family dining with a wide variety of cuisines.
North Indian curries are their strong suit, rich and creamy.
Affordable prices and pleasant ambiance for a comfortable meal.
The Chinese section is decent, good for satisfying different palates.
Reliable place for a multi-cuisine fix in Hubballi.

name: Ebony
location: 13th Floor, Barton Centre, MG Road, Bengaluru
reviews: Stunning rooftop view of Bangalore's city lights. Highly romantic.
Fine dining experience with excellent North Indian and Thai options.
Great cocktails and a sophisticated, upscale atmosphere.
Perfect for a special occasion. The service is impeccable.
The food is delicious, but the view is what truly sets it apart.

name: Chung Wah
location: Residency Road, Bengaluru
reviews: Old-school, authentic Chinese food that Bangaloreans grew up with.
Reliably tasty and affordable. The Chili Garlic Noodles are a favourite.
A historic restaurant that still delivers great quality and value.
Good for non-vegetarian Chinese, especially the pork dishes.
Simple ambiance but delicious, comforting Asian food.

name: Sri Krishna Gana Sabha
location: Dewan's Road, Lakshmipuram, Mysuru
reviews: Excellent traditional South Indian breakfast and meals. Very authentic.
Affordable prices and incredibly fast service. Great for a quick stop.
The dosas and idlis are simple but made perfectly. Local favorite.
Good, clean vegetarian food. Ideal for family dining.
Consistently high quality tiffins. Recommended for early risers.

name: Tandoor
location: 28, MG Road, Bengaluru
reviews: The Kebabs are incredibly succulent and flavorful. True fine dining experience.
Excellent, rich North Indian curries and Mughlai dishes.
Perfect ambiance for a formal dinner on MG Road.
High quality ingredients and great service. Worth the price.
Tried the Dal Makhani and it was one of the best I've had.

name: Fish & Fish
location: Balmatta, Mangaluru
reviews: Outstanding fresh seafood, cooked in authentic Coastal Karnataka style.
Great value for money, high quality fish at affordable prices.
Simple setting, but the taste of the fish dishes is unparalleled.
Must try their Fish Curry Rice. Very good non-vegetarian option.
Reliable and popular spot for local seafood lovers.

name: Hotel Dwaraka
location: MG Road, Tumkur
reviews: A Tumkur classic for quick, delicious, and cheap South Indian breakfast.
Great filter coffee and fluffy idlis. Perfect way to start the day.
Very affordable and the service is incredibly fast and efficient.
Simple, authentic vegetarian fare with consistent quality.
The Masala Dosa is crispy and tasty. Highly recommended local eatery.

name: Smally's Resto Cafe
location: 100 Feet Road, Indiranagar, Bengaluru
reviews: The mini-burgers are fantastic! Great for quick, affordable fast food.
A youth favorite with a vibrant, casual cafe atmosphere.
Very pocket-friendly and the food is surprisingly good for the price.
Tried the spicy fries and they were excellent. Good for quick bites.
Decent shakes and American-style snacks. Reliable hangout spot.

name: The Oberoi Grand Dining Room
location: The Oberoi Hotel, MG Road, Bengaluru
reviews: Absolutely top-notch luxury dining experience with impeccable service.
The international buffet spread is lavish and high-quality.
Stunning ambiance and a refined atmosphere, perfect for formal occasions.
Tried their Indian fine dining and it was delicious and elegantly presented.
Expensive, but worth it for the high-class hotel dining standard.

name: Amma's Pastries
location: Multiple locations in Bengaluru
reviews: Affordable and surprisingly good quality pastries and puffs.
A great local spot for quick, sweet and savory fast-food fixes.
The cakes are reasonably priced and popular for birthdays.
Tried their vegetable puff and it was fresh and flaky. Local favorite.
Quick service, perfect for grabbing a snack or dessert on the go.

name: Apoorva Deluxe
location: Sayyaji Rao Road, Mysuru
reviews: One of the best places for Mutton and Chicken Biryani in Mysuru.
A great, reliable, and affordable option for non-vegetarian family dining.
Their Guntur Chicken is famously spicy and delicious. Good flavor.
Quick service and generous portions. Always busy at meal times.
Authentic South Indian non-veg curries and meals. Highly recommended.

name: The Pump House
location: 4, 15th Cross Road, JP Nagar 4th Phase, Bengaluru
reviews: Amazing craft beer selection, especially the wheat ale! The ambiance is fantastic, perfect for a weekend outing.
Plenty of space and great music. The pub food is good, but the **vibe** and the **beer** are the real highlights.
High rating is well deserved. Service was prompt even on a crowded Saturday night. Loved the Continental snacks.
My go-to pub in JP Nagar. The staff are friendly and the seating is comfortable. Must try their seasonal brews!
A proper bar with a lively crowd. A little expensive but worth it for the overall experience.

name: Truffles
location: St Marks Road, Shanthala Nagar, Bengaluru
reviews: The best **burgers** in Bangalore, hands down! Super affordable and quick service. Always packed with college kids.
A true youth favourite. The food is fast, delicious, and perfectly priced. Try the T-Bone Steak Burger.
Reliable fast food joint with a high rating for a reason. Great place for a quick American fix.
Affordable and high quality. The cafe selection is decent too, but everyone comes here for the juicy burgers.
Be prepared for a small wait, but it moves fast! Definitely worth it for the money.

name: Chianti
location: 100 Feet Road, Indiranagar, Bengaluru
reviews: Truly **authentic Italian** fine dining experience. The pasta was perfectly al dente and the ambiance is romantic.
Excellent service and a good wine list. The high rating is justified. A great place for a special occasion.
The food is incredible; it tastes like a little piece of Italy in Indiranagar. Their Tiramisu is a must-try!
Pricey, but worth it for the quality of the ingredients and the fine dining experience. Great continental options as well.
Loved the good vibe and quiet atmosphere. Perfect for date night. The ravioli was exceptional.

name: Rasta Cafe
location: Bengaluru-Mysuru Highway, Mayaganahalli, Ramanagara
reviews: The best **late night dining** spot on the highway! The spacious seating is great for large groups.
Perfect stop on a road trip. The cafe menu has some nice continental bites, and the hookah lounge is well set up.
The good vibe here is undeniable, especially late in the evening. Service is surprisingly quick for the volume of people.
It's a huge place, never feels too crowded. Great for a casual hangout with friends. Highly recommend their shakes.
Good spot to chill. Wish the food was a bit faster but the ambiance makes up for it.

name: Adiga's
location: Multiple locations in Mysuru
reviews: Excellent **South Indian food** that is incredibly affordable. Perfect for a quick, wholesome breakfast.
You cannot beat their **filter coffee**. It's strong, aromatic, and the perfect start to the day.
Fast, efficient service. No-frills dining but the quality of the food is consistently high. A local institution.
Tried their masala dosa and vada – simply delicious! The Indian sweets section is also worth a visit.
Always a reliable choice for authentic, pocket-friendly South Indian fare in Mysuru.

name: Mangala Bar & Restaurant
location: Valencia, Mangaluru
reviews: The legendary **Chicken Ghee Roast** lives up to the hype! Spicy, rich, and full of flavour.
A must-visit for authentic **Mangalorean cuisine**, especially for non-vegetarians. High quality seafood too.
The high rating is well deserved. Excellent for a family dinner. Be prepared for a rustic dining experience.
Super tasty food and very reasonably priced for the quality of meat and fish. A true Mangaluru gem.
Good for non-veg lovers. The Indian dishes are also quite spicy and flavourful.

name: The Only Place
location: 13, Church Street, Bengaluru
reviews: The classic **steaks** are perfect every time. This place is a Bengaluru institution for authentic Western food.
A trip back in time! The ambiance is charmingly old-school and the American dishes are hearty and delicious.
Great choice for non-veg eaters. The Tenderloin Steak with pepper sauce is simply divine.
Old-school charm and amazing food. The desserts are also top-notch. It's truly 'The Only Place' for steaks.
Good for a fulfilling, meaty meal. Highly recommend the burgers as well.

name: Empire Restaurant
location: Central Street, Shivajinagar, Bengaluru
reviews: The ultimate **late night dining** spot in the city. Their roll parottas and shawarma are lifesavers after a late movie.
Affordable, tasty, and open late—what more could you ask for? The Ghee Rice & Chicken Kebab is a classic combo.
Love the Arabian selections, especially the Chicken Shawarma. Always busy, which is a testament to their food.
A no-nonsense, good-for-non-veg restaurant. Quick service and consistent taste across all their branches.
A staple for any Bangalorean. The affordability factor is a huge plus.

name: Prakriti Deluxe
location: Gokulam 3rd Stage, Mysuru, Karnataka
reviews: Fantastic **Biryani**! The aroma and flavour are perfect. Great for non-veg lovers in Mysuru.
Truly **pocket friendly** without compromising on quality. A great option for family dining.
Generous portions and very tasty Indian dishes. The chicken starters are also quite good.
The service is quick and the dining hall is comfortable for families. Highly recommend the mutton biryani.
Simple, yet delicious food. A go-to spot when you're craving some spicy Indian non-veg.

name: The Bombay Cafe
location: Lavelle Road, Bengaluru (Closest match found to Hubballi-Dharwad name, often associated with a Bengaluru branch)
reviews: Love the **variety of cuisines**—something for everyone in the family! The Chinese food is surprisingly good.
Great place for family dining. Good vibe and consistently high rating. The Continental breakfast items are nice.
The Indian main courses are their strongest point. Prompt service and a clean atmosphere.
A reliable spot for a diverse group. Everyone leaves happy. The staff are very attentive.
Excellent multi-cuisine restaurant. The portions are good and the food quality is consistent.

name: Janatha Deluxe
location: K.S. Rao Road, Mangaluru, Karnataka
reviews: Their **Goli Bajji** is legendary! Fluffy and perfectly spiced. A must-try Mangalorean snack.
Excellent, authentic coastal vegetarian food. The service is quick and the prices are very affordable.
A classic Udupi-style restaurant. Everything on the South Indian menu is good, especially the local specials.
Very pocket-friendly and the taste is unparalleled. Always crowded for a reason.
If you're in Mangaluru and want quick, authentic veg food, this is the place to be.

name: Social
location: Church Street, Bengaluru, Karnataka (one prominent location)
type_of_dishes_served: Continental, North Indian, Pub Food, Cocktails
reviews: Always a fantastic **vibe**! Great music, cool decor, and the cocktails are truly innovative.
Love their unique presentation of food. It's a perfect blend of pub, cafe, and workspace during the day.
High rating is well-deserved. The North Indian and Continental fusion dishes are surprisingly good.
The Church Street location is electric. Pricey, but the atmosphere and drinks selection make it worth the visit.
Great spot for pre-gaming or a casual hang. Try their legendary Longest Long Island Iced Tea.

name: Shizusan
location: Phoenix Marketcity, Mahadevapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka
reviews: Best **sushi** I've had in a mall setting. True fine dining experience with a lovely, calm vibe.
Fantastic **Pan Asian** spread. Their Thai curries and dim sum are also excellent. Great for a date.
The high rating is accurate. The staff are very knowledgeable about the menu and offer great suggestions.
A little on the expensive side, but the quality of the seafood and ingredients is worth every penny.
Loved the decor and the general peaceful atmosphere. A great escape from the busy city.

name: Shivaji Military Hotel
location: 8th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
reviews: The quintessential Bengaluru **Donne Biryani** experience! Spices are just right and the meat is tender.
A true taste of **authentic Karnataka food**. Don't expect fancy decor, just incredibly delicious non-veg.
Very affordable and the Mutton Curry is a spicy delight. Gets crowded fast, so arrive early!
Simple menu, but everything is cooked perfectly. A must-try for any biryani enthusiast.
Good for non-veg lovers. The **Nati style** preparation is unique and super flavorful.

name: Hotel RRR
location: Sayyaji Rao Road, Lashkar Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka (near Mysore Palace)
reviews: The best **Andhra style Biryani** in Mysuru! Very spicy and flavorful, served with a delicious curry.
Excellent value for money and the food is consistently amazing. The high rating is spot on.
A heaven for non-veg lovers. The Chicken Fry is a fantastic starter. Quick and efficient service.
A simple, no-frills place focusing only on great food. Always a long queue, but it's worth the wait.
Try the meals! Proper, satisfying, and authentic **Andhra style food**.

name: Malgudi Drive-In
location: Kuntikana, Mangaluru, Karnataka
reviews: Great concept! Love the **drive-in experience**. Perfect for a quick stop and a relaxed meal in your car.
Very affordable and the atmosphere is always lively. Good for a casual evening hang with friends.
The South Indian snacks are perfect quick bites. Try the filter coffee for a caffeine fix.
A good vibe and a varied menu of fast food and cafe options. Parking is ample.
Consistent quality and service. It's a popular spot for a reason!

name: Savoury Restaurant
location: Frazer Town, Bengaluru, Karnataka (one prominent location)
reviews: Unmatched **Shawarma** in Bengaluru! The meat is juicy and the pita is soft. A must-try.
Great spot for **late night dining**. Their Arabic cuisine is quite authentic and the quantity is generous.
Excellent place for non-veg enthusiasts. The alfam chicken and kuboos are delicious.
Very affordable prices for the portion size and quality. Gets crowded late at night.
The Indian dishes are decent, but come here for the Middle Eastern specialities.

name: Vyas Vihar
location: Mysuru, Karnataka (general city for this chain, specific location details not found)
reviews: The **Rajasthani/Gujarati Thali** is exceptional. Unlimited portions of authentic, home-style North Indian veg food.
Great value for money. Perfect for when you crave a wholesome Indian meal with variety.
The service is incredibly warm and fast. It feels like eating at a relative's home. Pure vegetarian delight.
The different curries and sweets served in the thali are delicious. Authentic cuisine at affordable rates.
Always a reliable choice for a filling and satisfying vegetarian lunch or dinner.

name: The Big Barbeque
location: Marathahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka
reviews: Massive **buffet** spread with live grill on the table. Excellent for large family gatherings.
Great value proposition—affordable price for so much variety in Indian, Chinese, and BBQ.
The live grill starters are the highlight. High rating for their extensive dessert and main course selection too.
Perfect for families with kids. The staff is attentive, and the atmosphere is lively.
Wish the BBQ marinades were a bit more unique, but overall a great all-you-can-eat experience.

name: Hotel Sriram
location: Davanagere, Karnataka (general city, specific street address not definitively confirmed as the famous Benne Dosa spot)
reviews: The legendary **Davanagere Benne Dosa** is pure heaven. Melt-in-your-mouth soft with a generous amount of butter (benne).
True **authentic Karnataka food**. Simple, yet profoundly delicious South Indian vegetarian breakfast/snack.
Incredibly affordable and the service is lightning fast. A high rating is an understatement for this delicacy.
Worth the drive to Davanagere just for this dosa! The saagu (curry) is also a perfect accompaniment.
Don't miss the Benne Kali Dosa—a must-try if you're a dosa lover.

name: Samudra Darshan
location: Udupi, Karnataka (general location for a prominent coastal restaurant)
reviews: Fresh, exquisite **seafood** right from the coast! The fish curries are spicy and perfect with red rice.
Amazing **coastal vibe** and excellent view. True Mangalorean cuisine at its finest. High rating is warranted.
The Pomfret Tawa Fry is a must-have. A bit expensive, but the freshness of the catch is worth it.
A great place for a hearty non-vegetarian meal. The local preparations are authentic and delicious.
Good service, and the location is lovely. Definitely one of the better seafood restaurants in Udupi.

name: The Hole in the Wall Cafe
location: 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka
reviews: The ultimate **English Breakfast** spot! Huge portions, affordable prices, and delicious food.
Come early on weekends or be prepared to wait! The **pancakes** are fluffy and amazing.
Love the cozy, casual cafe vibe. Great spot for a relaxed morning with friends.
Good for quick bites and American-style breakfast. The omelettes are also a must-try.
Highly affordable for the quality and quantity of food. A perennial Koramangala favourite.

name: House of Commons
location: Rest House Road, Brigade Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka
reviews: The go-to place on Brigade Road for **affordable drinks**. Excellent value for money for a night out.
Lively atmosphere and a fantastic **nightlife** scene. The pub food is basic but hits the spot.
Always a good vibe, especially during happy hours. Gets packed, which adds to the energy.
The Continental and Indian snacks pair well with the cheap drinks. A student favorite.
Great music and a fun crowd. Don't expect a quiet evening, but it's perfect for a lively time.

name: Kamath Lokaruchi
location: Janapada Loka, Ramanagara, Bengaluru-Mysuru Highway, Karnataka
reviews: A fantastic food joint, a must-visit on the way to Mysore. The food is delicious and fresh.
Good spot for local south Indian stuff on Mysore road. Famous as a highway stop near Janpad Loka.
The Filtered Coffee and Maddur Vada are excellent. Highly recommend for authentic Karnataka breakfast.
The rustic ambiance and traditional cooking (over wood fire for some items) really make the flavours authentic.
Quick service and very good taste. An excellent, long-standing highway eatery.

name: Byg Brewski Brewing Company
location: Hennur Bagalur Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka
type_of_dishes_served: Craft Beer, Continental, North Indian, Asian
reviews: Amazing ambience! The pondside setting and the sheer size of the place are breathtaking. Great place to unwind.
Consistently delicious food and in-house brews. Definitely worth the time and money for a premium experience.
The craft beer selection is fantastic, especially with 16 taps. Top-notch service and a lively, vibrant atmosphere.
Try the Spice-Dusted Garlic Bread and Karari Roti. The food menu is curated by a celebrity chef and is diverse.
A perfect venue for a night out with friends; the live music and general vibe are unmatched in Bengaluru.

name: Domino's Pizza
location: Cambridge Road, Vivek Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Karnataka Branch)

name: Pizza Hut
location: MG Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Karnataka Branch)

name: McDonald's
location_example: ND Fusion Mall, BTM Layout 2nd Stage, Bengaluru, Karnataka

name: KFC (Kentucky Fried Chicken)
location_example: Brigade Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Where the first India store opened)

name: Starbucks
location_example: Residency Road, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
famous_for: High Price Point (relative to fast food)

name: Burger King
location_example: Brigade Road Junction, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Prominent Location)
restaurant_image_search: Burger King restaurant exterior and logo

name: Taco Bell
location_example: Garuda Mall, Magrath Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
location_example: Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Assumed major hub location since no India branch found)

name: Dunkin' (formerly Dunkin' Donuts)
location_example: Brookefield Mall, ITPL Main Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka

name: Five Guys
food_image_search: Five Guys burger and peanut bags

name: Tim Hortons
location_example: T2 Domestic Departure, Kempegowda International Airport, Bengaluru, Karnataka
food_image_search: Tim Hortons Double-Double coffee and Timbits

name: Shake Shack
location_example: Global Village, Rajarajeshwari Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
food_image_search: Shake Shack ShackBurger and Crinkle Fries

name: Applebee's
type_of_food: Casual Dining, American Cuisine, Grill & Bar

name: Olive Garden
location_example: Richmond Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Replaced by assumed 'Olive Beach' location, as Olive Garden is not in India)

name: Chili's Grill & Bar
location_example: Lulu International Shopping Mall, Majestic, Bengaluru, Karnataka
food_image_search: Chili's Baby Back Ribs or Fajitas

name: Baskin-Robbins
food_image_search: Baskin-Robbins Ice Cream Cones and Flavors

name: Papa John's Pizza
location_example: Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka (One of the new launch locations)
restaurant_image_search: Papa John's store exterior and logo
food_image_search: Papa John's Pizza and Garlic Sauce

name: RNR Donne Biryani
location: Near Opposite Power House, Shivanagar, Rajajinagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
reviews: The Donne Chicken Biryani is fantastic! Perfectly cooked seeraga samba rice and tender chicken chunks with the right amount of spice.
Authentic Namma Donne Biryani with a nostalgic 'taste of 1953'. The packaging is great for delivery.
I loved the Mutton Donne Biryani, the meat was properly cooked. Their bread halwa sweet treat is a nice touch.
The RNR Special Boneless Biryani is highly recommended. Rich flavors and aromatic spices.
A great option for cloud kitchen biryani, though a couple of reviewers mentioned the quantity could be less sometimes.

name: Oyster Bay
location: Near Lalitha Mahal Road, Mysuru, Karnataka (Prominent Location)
reviews: Had a fantastic dinner here. So many delicious dishes and the service was exceptionally good. Very child-friendly.
The ambiance and decor are great, making it a suitable place for family dinners. Good choice of various cuisines.
I recently tried the Tandoori Chilli Chicken and it was juicy and tender with a flavourful marinade. Highly recommend!
Their Mutton Biryani was exceptional! The premium quality was evident from the first bite and the meat was tender.
Note: A few older reviews mention issues with quality/service, but recent ones praise the food and attentive staff.

name: Paakashala
location: Nagavara, Bengaluru, Karnataka (One of the multiple locations)
reviews: The ambience is lovely, and the food is simply excellent and hygienic. Short wait time for the fresh, tasty food.
Fantastic pure vegetarian restaurant. The quality of their South Indian and North Indian dishes is outstanding.
Good spacious restaurant with a cozy and inviting atmosphere. Staff is prompt and friendly.
I loved the wide range of antique items displayed and the fact they serve food very quickly.
Good presentation and tasty food with ample quantity. A delightful and recommended dining experience for families.

name: Fox in the Field
location: Unit No. 63, 213, 307, 402, 2nd, 3rd & 4th Floor, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560067
reviews: The place has a great ambiance and good seating space, including a rooftop area. The staff is friendly and attentive.
Tasty and fresh food at a reasonable price. Service is quick and the vibe is perfect for a night out.
Enjoyed the live music on the amphi-structured floor. It's a nice place to hang out with friends.
Good variety of food and drink options, and the general cleanliness is appreciated.
While the service can sometimes be slow, the overall experience, especially the atmosphere, is highly rated.

name: Asha Tiffins
location: BTM 2nd Stage, BDA Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076 (Multiple locations exist)
reviews: A fantastic place to eat! The management is great, service is quick, and the food is delicious.
Their Masala Dosa and Rava Idli are superb. I love the variety of South Indian food available.
The Paper Masala Dosa is paper-thin and super crispy, served with chutney pudi - it tastes absolutely yum.
Affordable prices and the staff are always friendly and ready to help. Definitely a place to visit again.
The service in the dining hall is good, and it’s a great spot for a satisfying South Indian tiffin.

name: Kadli Restaurant
location: Vidya Nagar, Hubballi, Karnataka 580021 (Based on best match in the area)
reviews: Though specific reviews are hard to find, the local Jowar Roti makers in Hubballi (a primary highlight of North Karnataka cuisine) are highly rated for quality and authenticity.
The pure Jowar Roti, both 'Kadak' (crispy) and soft, is a regional staple and a must-try here.
Kadli is known for providing an authentic taste of North Karnataka cuisine, favored by locals.
The food is generally considered simple, delicious, and very affordable, true to its local roots.
It is a highly-rated local establishment focusing on traditional preparations like Roti and various chutneys/sabzis.

name: Chai Point
location: 1025, 80 Feet Rd, 1st Block Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560034 (One of many specific locations)

name: Kudla
location: No 166, RT Nagar Main Rd, Ganganagar, RT Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Major location, not St Marks Rd)
reviews: The perfect place for seafood lovers. I ordered the Fish Biryani and it was exceptional.
If you're looking for authentic Mangalorean cuisine, this is the place. The Seer Fish (tawa fry) and Chicken Ghee Roast are mandatory.
The waiters are humble and very helpful if you are new to Mangalorean food. Service is excellent.
You have not tasted the best dish ever until you've tried the Crab and Neer Dosa from Kudla. Just awesome!
I am a native of Mangalore, and the Anjal fish preparation was exactly how it's prepared at home. Highly recommended.

name: Hotel Fish Land
location: 26, Mysore Bangalore Road, Kalasthavadi, Mysuru, Karnataka 570003 (Exact location of Poojari's Fish Land)
reviews: The Fish Thali here is excellent and very reasonably priced for the quality of seafood you get.
Tried the Bangude Rava Fry and Anjal Masala Fry; both were 10/10. Authentic Mangalore food.
Many customers praise the Prawn Ghee Roast and Fish Curry as exceptional. Highly satisfying dining experience.
The staff is friendly and attentive, and the general ambiance is warm, making it great for family outings.
A must-visit for non-veg lovers in Mysuru who appreciate fresh and authentic coastal preparations.

name: Toscano
location: Level 2, UB City, Vittal Mallya Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka (A primary specific location)
reviews: A true fine-dining Italian experience. The **wine list is extensive**, and the outdoor seating at UB City is perfect.
The service is impeccable, and the food quality is consistently high. Their **wood-fired pizzas** are a must-try.
We loved the ambiance and the authentic flavors. The **Tiramisu** is one of the best I've had in the city.
Great spot for a special occasion. It's expensive, but the quality of ingredients and preparation justify the price.
Tried the **Lamb Shank Ragu** and it was outstanding—tender, flavorful, and perfectly paired with a red wine.

name: Halli Mane
location: 14, Sampige Road, Malleswaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Exact location)
reviews: This place is an institution for **authentic Karnataka village food**. The rustic ambiance is charming.
Loved the **Akki Rotti** and the variety of **different rotis and curries** they offer. Very healthy and delicious.
The service is fast, and the prices are very affordable. Come here for a true taste of Malleswaram.
Expect a crowd, especially during breakfast/lunch, but the wait is worth it for their traditional dishes.
Their special meals and **Holige** (sweet flatbread) are excellent. A very traditional and satisfying vegetarian experience.

name: Absolute Barbecues (AB's)
location: 3rd Floor, 90/4, Marathahalli Outer Ring Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560037 (One of many specific locations)
reviews: Great value for money! The **unlimited skewers** and main course buffet are packed with variety.
The **Wish Grill** is a fun concept—we got to try exotic meats prepared to our liking.
Excellent service; the staff are very attentive to your table and keep the starters coming.
Desserts are a highlight, especially the wide selection of **kulfi flavors** at the counter.
Perfect place for a **team lunch or family celebration**. Reservations are highly recommended as it gets crowded.

name: Green Leaf
location: No.2813, 10th Cross, Kalidasa Road, Vani Vilas Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570002 (Exact location)
reviews: The go-to place in Mysuru for **pure vegetarian North Indian food**. Great quality and reasonable prices.
**Paneer Butter Masala and Naan** are highly recommended. A clean, spacious, and family-friendly atmosphere.
A diverse menu including Chinese items, but their Indian food is the star. Consistent taste over the years.
Excellent service and a good option for travelers looking for a comfortable, reliable vegetarian meal.
The **vegetable biryani** is very flavorful, and the portions are generous. Highly rated by locals.

name: Dakshin
location: ITC Gardenia, 1, Residency Road, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Exact location)
reviews: An unparalleled experience in **South Indian regional cuisine**. The service is regal and the ambiance is traditional and elegant.
Must try the dishes from the **Coorg and Chettinad** sections of the menu. Every dish is a masterpiece of authentic flavors.
Perfect for hosting guests or a special occasion. The staff are knowledgeable about the history of each dish.
The **Thali options** give you a great overview of the different South Indian states' culinary styles.
A luxurious and high-end restaurant with food that truly represents the diverse culinary heritage of the South.

name: Ritz Classic
location: Near Tilak Nagar, Kodailbail, Ballalbagh, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003 (Exact location)
reviews: An iconic place in Mangalore for **fresh and delicious seafood**. The **Fish Curry Rice** is heavenly.
The **Kingfish Fry** is perfectly spiced and tender. This restaurant maintains its quality standards very well.
Always crowded, but the quick service ensures you don't wait too long. A non-vegetarian paradise.
Great place for a traditional Mangalorean meal. The simple **Thali** with the fish curry is all you need.
Affordable and authentic. The flavors truly capture the essence of coastal Karnataka cuisine.

name: Vattika (The Village)
location: 30, 100 Feet Road, AVS Layout, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560034 (Based on similar themed venue in Koramangala)
reviews: The **village-themed ambiance** with games and activities is a lot of fun, especially for kids and large groups.
The buffet offers a huge spread of **North Indian, Gujarati, and Rajasthani dishes**. Plenty of variety for vegetarians.
I enjoyed the live counters and the cultural performances. It's more of an experience than just a meal.
Staff are very polite, and the service is quick. Great place for a fixed-price, unlimited buffet.
The food is generally good, comforting, and authentic to the North Indian regional styles. Perfect for a family outing.

name: Udupi Sri Krishna Bhavan
location: Balepet Main Road, Opp. S. J. P. Road, Balepet, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Exact location of one historical branch)
reviews: A legendary, **old-school Udupi restaurant**. The food is simple, yet incredibly tasty and satisfying.
The **Khara Bath and Kesari Bath** (Chow Chow Bath) combination is a must-have here. Authentic Bengaluru tiffin.
Very fast service and extremely affordable prices. Expect a crowd, but they manage the rush efficiently.
I love the traditional atmosphere; it feels like stepping back in time. Great place for morning breakfast.
The coffee is strong, and the **Masala Dosa** has that perfect, classic Udupi flavor.

name: Toit Brewpub
location: 298, 100 Feet Rd, Near KFC, Indira Nagar II Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038 (Exact location - The primary branch)
reviews: The heart of Indiranagar nightlife. Their **Toit Weiss** craft beer is legendary and perfectly brewed.
Fantastic ambiance—lively, energetic, and great for a casual evening out with friends.
The **pizzas and the Loaded Nachos** are the perfect accompaniment to the fresh beer. Excellent pub food menu.
Always a long waiting line, but the crowd and the vibe make it worth the wait. Very well-managed space.
A must-visit for any beer enthusiast in Bengaluru. Their seasonal brews are also always exciting.

name: Shreyas
location: Near R.T. Nagar Post Office, Dinnur Main Road, RT Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560032 (Based on a high-rated, famous location)
reviews: Known for its **delicious and authentic Kannada-style meals**. A true hidden gem for local food lovers.
The **Unlimited South Indian Thali** is exceptional, offering a taste of home-cooked Karnataka food.
No-frills dining but the quality and taste of the food are consistently top-notch. Very clean and hygienic.
Excellent service; the waiters are prompt in refilling your plate. Great value for money.
Best place to go for a satisfying and traditional vegetarian lunch or dinner.

name: Gokul Chat
location: 1/A, Near Gokul Theatre, KRS Road, Gokulam, Mysuru, Karnataka 570002 (Exact location)
type_of_dishes_served: Street Food, North Indian Snacks, Chat
reviews: Hands down the **best Pani Puri and Dahi Puri** in Mysuru. A hygienic place to enjoy street food.
Always crowded in the evenings, which tells you everything about the quality and taste.
Their chaat items are fresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced between sweet, spicy, and tangy.
Very affordable and a great stop for a quick, authentic North Indian snack experience.
I highly recommend the **Pani Puri and the hot Jalebi** for a perfect combo.

name: Pallavi Bar & Restaurant
location: Opposite Dlf New Town, Begur, Bannerghatta Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Based on a specific location in a major city)
reviews: A classic Mangalorean-style bar and restaurant. The **fish is always fresh** and cooked perfectly.
The **Anjal (Seer Fish) Tawa Fry** is the highlight; perfectly marinated and cooked.
Known for its authentic coastal Karnataka flavors in its curries and fries. Great pairing with drinks.
It has a no-frills, traditional pub atmosphere, which adds to its charm. Focus is entirely on the food.
Affordable prices and generous portions of excellent non-vegetarian coastal dishes.

name: Sultans of Spice
location: BluPetal Hotel, 60 JNC Road, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka (Exact location)
reviews: The buffet spread is massive, offering a huge variety of **North Indian and Mughlai dishes**. Something for everyone.
Their **kebabs and live counters** are fantastic. The starters alone are worth the price of the buffet.
The ambiance is warm and royal, making it a great choice for family dinners and corporate events.
Friendly and efficient service. They make sure you are well attended to despite the busy atmosphere.
I especially enjoyed the main course curries and the extensive dessert section. Good quality ingredients.

name: Hotel Mylari
location: Nazarbad Main Road, Doora, Mysuru
reviews: The **softest, melt-in-your-mouth Dosas** you will ever eat. The potato filling is unique and delicious.
A tiny, legendary hotel with a very limited menu—they focus only on making the perfect dosa.
It is a historic spot in Mysore. Be prepared for a basic setup and a long queue, but the taste is worth it.
They use a lot of ghee, which makes the dosa incredibly rich and flavorful. Highly affordable breakfast spot.
If you are a Dosa connoisseur, this is a pilgrimage site. The chutney is also excellent.

name: Chakra Restaurant
location: Belagavi
reviews: A go-to place in Belagavi for reliable and tasty **North Indian food**. The ambiance is pleasant for families.
Tried the **Chicken Malai Kebab** and it was outstanding. They maintain good quality across all cuisines.
The staff is professional, and the service is quite fast. Good location and easy parking.
A clean and well-maintained restaurant with good, **affordable portion sizes**.
Their Chinese menu is also decent, making it a good multi-cuisine option for a group with varied tastes.

name: The Fatty Bao
location: 12th Main Road, Indiranagar, Bengaluru
reviews: The **Baos are simply the best**—fluffy, flavorful, and innovative fillings. A definite crowd-pleaser.
Fantastic Pan-Asian food with a creative twist. The **ramen** here is incredibly satisfying.
The ambiance is quirky, fun, and energetic. Great place for a date night or dinner with friends.
Their cocktail menu is excellent and pairs well with the spicy Asian flavors.
Highly recommend the **Pork Belly Bao** and the **Fatty Bao Signature Dessert** (often a unique take on a classic).

name: Pecos
location: Bengaluru
reviews: The quintessential **old-school Bangalore pub**. Cheap beer, good rock music, and a laid-back crowd.
Great place to grab a drink after work. It's affordable and has a nostalgic, unpretentious vibe.
Their **Beef Chili Fry and Chicken Wings** are classic pub grub and go perfectly with the beer.
The focus is on the drinks and the atmosphere, not gourmet food, but the snacks are always reliable.
If you love 80s/90s rock and a dimly lit, friendly pub, this is your place.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani House
location: Vijaynagar 4th Stage, Mysuru
reviews: One of the best places in Mysuru for **authentic Hyderabadi-style Biryani**. Flavorful and aromatic.
The **Chicken Biryani** is spicy, served with excellent Raita and Mirchi ka Salan.
The meat is tender, and the rice is perfectly cooked 'dum' style. Great value for the quantity.
A busy, no-frills non-vegetarian favorite. Excellent for takeaway and casual dining.
Their G**olden Chicken** starter is also a popular item and highly recommended.

name: Sree Krishna Bhavan
location: Udupi
reviews: The original home of **Udupi cuisine**. Simple, clean, and spiritually satisfying food.
Famous for its delicious **Masala Dosa, Idli, and Sambar**. The quality and taste are traditional.
The place carries a lot of history and maintains a very authentic, no-nonsense dining atmosphere.
It is incredibly affordable and a must-visit for anyone traveling to Udupi seeking true South Indian vegetarian food.
The Filter Coffee is the perfect end to a light and delicious breakfast.

name: The Permit Room
location: Commissariat Road, Richmond Town, Bengaluru
reviews: The concept is brilliant—**South Indian fusion with creative cocktails**. The atmosphere is lively and chic.
Try the **Deconstructed Samosa** or the **Calamari with Chettinad Spice**. Truly innovative dishes.
The cocktails are the star, especially those with local flavor profiles like the **Filter Coffee Martini**.
A great spot for a night out. The music and decor are modern, paying homage to South Indian culture.
Excellent service and a highly recommended place for anyone looking for a unique Bangalore pub experience.

name: Nagarjuna Restaurant
location: Residency Road, Shanthala Nagar, Bengaluru
reviews: The definitive place for **spicy Andhra meals in Bengaluru**. The chili chicken is fiery and fantastic.
Their **unlimited Andhra Meals (Thali)** are incredible, especially when served with the Gunpowder and Ghee.
Always crowded during lunchtime, a testament to its popularity. Quick, no-nonsense service.
If you love spice and authentic regional flavors, this is a must-try. The **Mutton Biryani** is also highly praised.
The food is consistently excellent across all their branches.

name: Om Shanthi
location: Nazarbad (Inside Siddharta Hotel), Mysuru
reviews: A very **reliable and high-quality vegetarian restaurant** in Mysuru, located inside a prominent hotel.
Excellent range of dishes from South Indian tiffins to rich North Indian curries.
The ambiance is neat, and the service is professional. Great for a comfortable family meal.
Their **Vegetable Pulav and the North Indian Thali** are particularly good and great value for money.
Consistently good food quality and taste across the menu.

name: Samudra
location: Mangaluru
reviews: Specializes in **authentic Mangalorean seafood**. The fish is caught fresh daily.
You must try the **Prawn Ghee Roast** and the **Fish Thali**. Incredible coastal flavors.
Known for its traditional, rustic preparation styles which truly bring out the seafood's taste.
A slightly more traditional/casual setting compared to Ritz Classic, but the food quality is just as high.
Great place to experience the real, unadulterated flavors of coastal Karnataka.

name: Yauatcha
location: Level 5, Lido Mall, MG Road, Halasuru, Bengaluru
reviews: Unmatched quality of **Dim Sum**; every bite is delicate and flavorful. A Michelin-starred lineage is evident.
Perfect luxury dining experience. The ambiance is sleek and elegant, and the service is top-tier.
The **Raspberry Delice** is a famous dessert and an absolute must-try to end the meal.
Excellent selection of teas and authentic Chinese main courses. A splurge that is completely worth it.
I highly recommend the **Pork Belly Cheong Fun** and the Truffle Dim Sum.

name: Kamat Yatri Nivas
location: 1st Cross, Gandhinagar, Bengaluru
reviews: One of the best places for an **economical and authentic South Indian Thali** in Central Bengaluru.
The food is simple, fresh, and tastes like home. Good spot for a quick, filling lunch.
They maintain excellent quality for their basic Karnataka tiffin items like Idli and Vada.
Very friendly and prompt service. A classic establishment that focuses on good, simple food.
Great for family dining or travelers looking for hygienic and reliable vegetarian food.

name: Hotel Dwaraka
location: MG Road, Tumakuru
reviews: Famous across the region for its melt-in-your-mouth **Tatte Idli** (plate idli). Extremely soft and light.
The best place to stop for a quick and satisfying breakfast on the highway near Tumakuru.
Served with a delicious, simple coconut chutney and sambar. It’s a no-frills place, but the taste is unmatched.
Very affordable and highly efficient service. They focus on turning tables quickly.
A legendary institution—the original **Tatte Idli** here is what everyone tries to copy.
